reviewText:
Shmupping again!

I got a key from the developer of the review. It doesn't change my opinion in any bit whatsoever.
SIG reminds me of Platypus, and carries both it's best traits, and it's worst.

Pros:Fun power-ups with a variety of bullet sprays to play with.
The Time Distortion mechanic is really awesome! It doubles use for helping you dodge bullets and getting extra hits on a enemy.
Co-Op Mode is pretty great too, like Platypus!
A great variety of enemies!Nitpicks:The game is way too difficult. That isn't to say shmups like this aren't as difficult as this, but it's difficulty is sort of the back-bone of this game's content. It's gonna take awhile to beat it, despite the short number of levels. It's a double-edged sword.
Music? What Music? (not memorable)
No rebindable controls. Xbox 360 has to use the horrible d-pad to play
When some explosion happens, the screen starts shaking. Nice effect, if it didn't make me feel sick.Cons:The artstyle is a clashing mess. The boss sprites look pretty good but the rest look like a horrible 8-bit mess. It doesn't feel coherrent.
The Sound Effects are really, really gratingThe Review
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=617019227

Seriously, doesn't this game remind you of Platypus? I like the variety of power-ups that drop, and most importantly, the balance of the power-ups. The overpowered ones that do a insane amount of damage but you can lose them in a single hit. It's not a perfect balance, but is that really important? The best weapons will make the game much more easier at the cost of it losing the minute you get hit. The power-ups drop a lot though, so don't be too worried on losing your weapon.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=617019206

Co-Op was a pretty neat highlight too. Hook it up and you've got a fun game to play with friends! Definitely reminds me of the days when I was playing [i[Platypus[/i] Co-Op with some good ol' buddies. Now despite how much I like Platypus, it's main flaws in it's cheap one hit you're dead" mechanics were really grating. SIG doesn't have that thankfully
date: but it does have Platypus' main double-edged sword
hoursPlayed: the best I could get was level 6
voteText: this game is way too hard!\n\nAlso
helpfulPercent: the screen shakes a lot and that's really annoying\n\nThe real highlight is the Time Distortion mechanic. While it doesn't work like it
votesHelpful: it feels like the Bayonetta Witch Time. You can double it as a way to dodge narrow bullets
votesTotal: or get a ton of shots at a opening. I like that kind of dynamic mechanic
votesFunny:
and it really makes what would otherwise be a simple shmup so much more interesting.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=617019171

My biggest gripe are the bosses. They are literal bullet sponges
commentsCount: go down easily with the OP weapons
column16: and with a few upgrades only take a long time. They feel uninteresting to say the least
column17: and are absolutely disappointing. And the sound design is absolutely grating.\n\nOtherwise though
column18: I can see this being a good time killer. It's hard to get down with completely due to a lot of problems
column19: particularly it's incoherrent artstyle and poor bosses
column20: but it's not a bad price for a great game to play. And I freaking miss Platypus so much that I've been longing for another shooter like it. Doesn't exactly fill the quota
column21: but still fun!\n\nTL;DR - It's not exactly high quality
column22: but what it's quality shines at is being absolute fun.\nFINAL VERDICT: Recommended with Caution. Also recommended to fans of Platypus.\nFor more reviews on all sorts of games

reviewText: Really cool game, especially in local co-op mode.\n\nTIP: when choosing upgrades, pick the health regen upgrade if available. It really helps you survive the bosses.

reviewText:
An Arcade Side-Scrolling Shooterhttps://youtu.be/lD4zCmbQdyQ
+ A large variety of weapons that each have a special charge attack
+ Lots of craziness, flashing, and explosions that make each level pretty intense
+ Good chiptune music
+ Lots of unique enemies
+ Bosses are challenging

- You have to tap A (or the fire button) repeatedly to attack which gets very tiresome after a while
- Very high difficutly / not enough health pick-ups, most people probably won't make it very far which limits the overall content

reviewText: A mild recommendation, partly because I like schmups and this one is really cheap. I think what bothers me, and this isn't super important to gameplay I admit, is the art style. On the one had we have these quite charming 8-bit style sprites such as the characters you play as and some of the enemies. Then other enemies look like they were thrown together in MS Paint and are utterly hideous. These sprites just look dreadful and I found them a little distracting, why not stick with the blocky pixel art for all of the sprites?\n\nStill, you can't go wrong for just a few bucks and it's fun enough with enough different powerups and a decent difficulty curve to make it worth a laugh. Playing co-op is probably really fun too as the screen can really fill up with all sorts of chaos. If they were to change how some of those enemies looked though I wouldn't complain.
voteText: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Really fun indie bullet hell game, lots of different characters to play as, and different bullet types to master (Lightsaber is the best one imo)
Even more fun Co-op!

The biggest cons i can think of, is the difficulty seems to be set really high right off the bat, and i wish there was more to do, but perfect price/gameplay ratio.

And you cant rebind keys? I really wish you could, space imo works much better as the shoot button.

Naked guy is obviously the best skin

Il just say this i LOVE games with random stuff+the fact its in a 16 bit style great for when you're bored!\nThe only thing i would suggest to be changed is the characters most of them are just square blocks with only 1 or 2 characters having a bit more detail but i woudn't mind if you guys kept it like this ;)
